title: Arsene Wenger provides his thoughts on title race as Man City lose ground on Liverpool
text:

Arsene Wenger has indicated it is Liverpool's title to lose this season - and that Arsenal are already too far away to mount a serious challenge.

The legendary Gunners boss guided the north London club to Premier League glory in three seasons during his time in charge.

He is the last manager to win silverware at Arsenal, and doesn't think they can win a first title since his departure this season, despite them being third in the table after eight games.

The Frenchman told Omnisport: "At the moment you can't look too much at the position because the points difference is very small.

(Image: beIN Sports)

"You draw, you're seventh; you win a game, you're third. I don't think [they can challenge for the title] at the moment on what I've seen."

Manchester City have won the Premier League title for the past two seasons, winning the 2018 campaign at the expense of Liverpool on the final day.

This season unbeaten Liverpool have stormed to the top of the table and are already eight points clear of Man City, who have slipped up in three matches.

(Image: Getty Images)

Wenger has suggested it is Liverpool's title to lose, claiming only Manchester City - and not Arsenal who are in third - can catch them.

He added: "Liverpool are too far ahead for everybody else. Manchester City looks to have the best potential to fight against Liverpool, but as long as you are not too far away, you can hope."
description: The legendary Arsenal manager guided the north London club to three Premier League titles during his time in charge
